= Connections =

  * ET (inferior input) – receives inputs from complex multisensory and higher order association areas of cerebral cortex via PCA.PCG
  * fornix (superior input) – receives:
   * ACh fibers from basal forebrain (septal nuclei and basal nucleus of Meynert) - *Novelty*
   * DA fibers from ventral tegmental area of the midbrain - *Reward*
   * 3HT fibers from raphe nuclei (midline pons and midbrain) - *Mood*
   * NE fibers from the locus ceruleus (floor of fourth ventricle) - *Attention*

= Citations =

{{{
- PH.PR is not important for object perception, but functions only in object memory
- HC and SUB are 3-layered cortices with prominent middle pyramidal layer
- DG is 3-layered cortex with a prominent middle granular layer
- afferent fibers from fornix and ET terminate on either pyramidal cells of HC directly or 
  on granule cells of DG which then project to pyramidal cells of HC
- HC.CA1, HC.CA3 have LTP property, but HC.CA2 does not
- HC.CA2 has highly significant difference in membrane potential from CA1, and it is more negative
- EC (L2) -> (HC.CA1) -> HC.CA3
- EC (L3) -> (HC.CA2) -> HC.CA1
}}}
